ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Refine ability of the Spanish langauge.
Practicing speaking and writing Spanish at the heritage level
I improved my grammar in Spanish.
It was great to take a Spanish class and work on my grammar and conversation skills since I haven't spoken Spanish regularly in a few years. I also got to work on my writing skills a lot!
Better understanding of spanish grammar (especially the subjunctive)
I've learned the complexity of grammar tenses, and have gained confidence in my verbal and writing abilities. I have also learned how to time manage a lot more appropriately.

This class helped further my Spanish abilities through both standard coursework such as grammatical lectures and real-world applications of the language. The topics covered were relevant to the pandemic and helped create a learning environment where the matter discussed had real implications.
I developed my skills in reading and writing in Spanish, especially in an academic context. Additionally, I gained a stronger understanding of Spanish grammar.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Lots of targeted feedback.
There were no weaknesses.

This class was awesome! Profesora Alexandrov puts so much effort into the class and making it enjoyable for the students. Even though it was online, I still had a great time each class and was excited every week for this class. There were so many activities, which made every lesson interesting. Also, another strength was that I actually got to know and get close to some of my classmates given the structure of the class; it felt great getting to know the other students and professor through conversations. Overall one of my favorite classes at yale so far
The course is incredibly interactive and the class dynamic made it really easy to participate. However sometimes everyone was really quite and it was difficult to keep a discussion going.

Strengths: Our learning was very well-paced. We didn't learn a new tense or grammar rule every day but would rather learn one and in the upcoming weeks, we would learn about the rule in various situations to understand why it is used. Our understanding of the tenses and structure was valued. 
Weaknesses: The spacing of assignments was not the best. Sometimes weeks would be very writing heavy that requires a lot more time and revision but the allotted time to hand in the assignment would be insufficient.

The class was extremely well organized and the grading made sure that any mistakes served as learning experiences. It was clear that the professor put much time into organizing and planning out lectures to best fit the needs of students.
Strengths: clear organization, good balance between lecturing and discussions, professor was responsive to feedback

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The class functioned as well as could be expected virtually.
I enjoyed the breakout rooms and having access to all of the presentations.
Profesora Alexandrov did an amazing job at making the class suitable for an online format! I can't think of any improvements that needed to be made.
We had lots of online group activities in breakout rooms but sometimes the rooms were too small and not enough people spoke.

The inclusion of our experiences during the COVID pandemic helped us process what was going on and learn about different perspectives on various topics both from a quantitative and qualitative standpoint.

Directing the subject matter of the class to the COVID-19 pandemic was great and ensured that the material felt relevant to the current day. The daily use of breakout rooms ensured that the class felt like a discussion rather than just a lecture, something difficult to achieve with online learning.

I think the collaborative google slides and the breakout rooms were a highly effective tool for both learning various grammatical structures and recreating the flow of an in personal classroom in a virtual setting. Additionally, I think the various assignments such as the Corona Cronologia were very creative and relevant to the time.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Highly recommend. The professor is top tier and shows an extreme amount of dedication and care towards her students. I have so much admiration for her teaching style and love of the subject. The professor makes an active effort to keep her lessons current, relevant, and interesting for her students.
A lot of work, but if you want to practice your Spanish its worth it.
I would if youre a native speaker!
Absolutely.

Yes, I had really enjoyed this class (even though it was a rather tough semester otherwise). You will learn Spanish in a way suitable for heritage speakers while also having fun alongside the other students!
Yes, all native speakers should take this close. It is so great to learn in an environment that supports heritage learners.
Yes, this class created a great and inviting environment for learning that made me excited to attend every day.

Definitely! I think it's a really cool experience to be able to learn in a group where everyone has experience learning Spanish and the class is very useful for refining proper grammatical structures or polishing your Spanish so that it is more academic. Also, Professor Alexandrov is great! She is very sweet and accommodating and makes the class really interactive and engaging.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: N/a
